title: Tigerman McCurry Archive

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of printed papers, typescript papers, architectural drawings, architecrtural reprographic prints, black and white photographic prints, color photographic prints, black and white negatives, color negatives, black and white slides, color slides, black and white transparencies, color transparencies, ink drawings, graphite drawings, maps, correspondence, printed papers, typescript papers, holograph papers, carbon typescript papers, posters, scrapbooks, cd-roms, hard drives, vhs videocassettes, and realia..

artist_display:
Stanley Tigerman (1930-2019)
Margaret McCurry (1942-)
Tigerman McCurry Architects
Tigerman Fugman McCurry
Chicago Seven
description:
Approximately 800 linear feet of architectural records, drawings and papers documenting the work of the Tigerman McCurry firm as well as the professional practice and associations of Margaret McCurry and Stanley Tigerman.

Related information can be found in the Stanley Tigerman Papers.

View finding aid.
Stanley Tigerman Oral History.

Collection access:
Collections may be accessed in the Franke Reading Room of the Research Center at The Art Institute of Chicago, by appointment only. For further information, consult the FAQ.
